title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Pink, orang and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed: Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 29
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Repeat pattern of graphite diamonds executed in short parallel graphite strokes alternating with yellow diamonds with open centers and squares with open quatrafoil centers and an"X" surrounded by small circles. Between larger motifs are small orange and pink diamonds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Pink, orang and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-447.
